message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning the underlying graph of an unknown Ising model from a collection of i.i.d. samples generated from the model. This problem is related to statistical learning and inference, which are typically covered in the machine learning (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of convex optimization, which is a common tool in optimization and control theory (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper deals with the analysis of the sample complexity of the proposed estimator, which is related to the study of algorithms and complexity (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes a new estimator that has a physical interpretation in terms of "interaction screening", which suggests a possible connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
